title.text: RFC 8602: Update to the Telephony Routing over IP (TRIP) IANA Registry Rules regarding Postal Addresses

contents.text:
Internet Engineering Task Force (IETF)                          J. Arkko
Request for Comments: 8602                                      Ericsson
Updates: 3219                                                  T. Hardie
Category: Standards Track                                      July 2019
ISSN: 2070-1721
Update to the Telephony Routing over IP (TRIP) IANA Registry Rules regarding Postal Addresses
contents.zh-CHS: 更新关于邮政地址的IP电话路由（TRIP）IANA注册规则

contents.text: Abstract
contents.zh-CHS: 摘要

contents.text: This memo updates the IANA registry rules for the Telephony Routing over IP (TRIP) protocol, by no longer requiring that postal addresses be included in contact information.
contents.zh-CHS: 此备忘录更新了IP电话路由（TRIP）协议的IANA注册规则，不再要求在联系信息中包含邮政地址。

contents.text: This memo updates RFC 3219.
contents.zh-CHS: 本备忘录更新了RFC 3219。

contents.text: Status of This Memo
contents.zh-CHS: 关于下段备忘

contents.text: This is an Internet Standards Track document.
contents.zh-CHS: 这是一份互联网标准跟踪文件。

contents.text: This document is a product of the Internet Engineering Task Force (IETF). It represents the consensus of the IETF community. It has received public review and has been approved for publication by the Internet Engineering Steering Group (IESG). Further information on Internet Standards is available in Section 2 of RFC 7841.
contents.zh-CHS: 本文件是互联网工程任务组（IETF）的产品。它代表了IETF社区的共识。它已经接受了公众审查，并已被互联网工程指导小组（IESG）批准出版。有关互联网标准的更多信息，请参见RFC 7841第2节。

contents.text: Information about the current status of this document, any errata, and how to provide feedback on it may be obtained at https://www.rfc-editor.org/info/rfc8602.
contents.zh-CHS: 有关本文件当前状态、任何勘误表以及如何提供反馈的信息，请访问https://www.rfc-editor.org/info/rfc8602.

1. Introduction
contents.zh-CHS: 1. 介绍

contents.text: This memo updates the IANA registry rules for the Telephony Routing over IP (TRIP) protocol, by no longer requiring that postal addresses be included in contact information. No use for the addresses is identified, and omitting this information provides a privacy benefit.
contents.zh-CHS: 此备忘录更新了IP电话路由（TRIP）协议的IANA注册规则，不再要求在联系信息中包含邮政地址。未确定地址的用途，省略此信息可提供隐私保护。

contents.text: This memo updates RFC 3219.
contents.zh-CHS: 本备忘录更新了RFC 3219。

contents.text: 2. IANA Considerations
contents.zh-CHS: 2. IANA考虑

contents.text: This memo updates the registration rules [RFC8126] for TRIP Attributes ([RFC3219], Section 13.2) and TRIP IP Telephony Administrative Domain (ITAD) Numbers ([RFC3219], Section 13.5) as follows.
contents.zh-CHS: 本备忘录更新了行程属性（[RFC3219]，第13.2节）和行程IP电话管理域（ITAD）号码（[RFC3219]，第13.5节）的注册规则[RFC8126]，如下所示。

contents.text: The IETF no longer requires IANA to collect postal address information when adding TRIP registry entries. Additionally, IANA has removed previously collected postal addresses from the registries.
contents.zh-CHS: IETF不再要求IANA在添加TRIP注册表项时收集邮政地址信息。此外，IANA已从登记处删除以前收集的邮政地址。

contents.text: 3. Security Considerations
contents.zh-CHS: 3. 安全考虑

contents.text: No security impacts of this change have been identified.
contents.zh-CHS: 尚未确定此变更的安全影响。

contents.text: 4. Normative References
contents.zh-CHS: 4. 规范性引用文件

contents.text: [RFC3219] Rosenberg, J., Salama, H., and M. Squire, "Telephony Routing over IP (TRIP)", RFC 3219, DOI 10.17487/RFC3219, January 2002, <https://www.rfc-editor.org/info/rfc3219>.
contents.zh-CHS: [RFC3219]Rosenberg，J.，Salama，H.，和M.Squire，“IP电话路由（TRIP）”，RFC 3219，DOI 10.17487/RFC3219，2002年1月<https://www.rfc-editor.org/info/rfc3219>.

contents.text: [RFC8126] Cotton, M., Leiba, B., and T. Narten, "Guidelines for Writing an IANA Considerations Section in RFCs", BCP 26, RFC 8126, DOI 10.17487/RFC8126, June 2017, <https://www.rfc-editor.org/info/rfc8126>.
contents.zh-CHS: [RFC8126]Cotton，M.，Leiba，B.，和T.Narten，“在RFC中编写IANA考虑事项部分的指南”，BCP 26，RFC 8126，DOI 10.17487/RFC8126，2017年6月<https://www.rfc-editor.org/info/rfc8126>.

contents.text: Acknowledgements
contents.zh-CHS: 致谢

contents.text: The authors would like to thank Michelle Cotton, Alissa Cooper, and Jonathan Rosenberg for interesting discussions in this problem space. The authors would also like to thank Carlos Pignataro, Russ Housley, Abdussalam Baryun, and Paul Wouters for feedback.
contents.zh-CHS: 作者要感谢Michelle Cotton、Alissa Cooper和Jonathan Rosenberg在这个问题空间进行了有趣的讨论。作者还要感谢卡洛斯·皮格纳塔罗、罗斯·霍斯利、阿卜杜萨兰国的巴伦和保罗·沃特斯的反馈。
